title: Secondary Mathematics and Language Integrated Education Design Project Utilizing AR Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, proficiency in basic mathematical terminology and graph interpretation, and ability to comprehend fundamental technical texts
context.additional_context: Learners assume expert roles (technical fields) and use AR creation tools to design and evaluate math problem-solving scenarios. Digital devices (tablets/smartphones) and AR platforms (HP Reveal/Blippar) are provided, requiring clear linguistic expression (formulas, graph descriptions, report writing) in mathematical modeling. Evaluation considers both mathematical accuracy and linguistic clarity.

learning_goals: Enhancing spatial perception and problem-solving skills using mathematical representations (graphs, equations) by creating and manipulating 3D geometric models with AR technology.

Through PBL team collaboration (3–4 members), learners select one real-world problem (building design or data visualization), develop a mathematical model with over 80% completeness following a given framework (problem definition → variable extraction → formulation → validation), and achieve at least 3 points (out of 4) on peer/teacher evaluation checklists (clarity, logic, applicability). Additionally, they must use precise mathematical terminology and logical expressions during model development.

After conducting formative assessments (quizzes, observation checklists) on three AR contents, learners write an educational effectiveness analysis report achieving at least 4 points (5-point scale) in interactivity and intuitiveness. The report must include mathematical analysis results and clear linguistic expression (vocabulary, grammar, logical flow).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
